file_content.text: ...I just think it might put everyone at ease if you ditched the lightsaber.
Get down to that lab and see what's happening. I'll stay in contact.
Hey. I just called Tee-Three to have him find you, but it looks like you were already on the way. That's impressive timing.
What are you doing here, Theron?
Digging, just like I said I would. Let me show you what I've got so far.
Hey. I just called Tee-Three to have him find you, and he said you were already on the way. That's some impressive timing.
Why are we here, Theron? What is this all about?
Let's run through what I've got so far.
Colonel Darok commanded our strike on Korriban, supposedly to gather valuable intelligence data--none of which has been turned over to the SIS.
This is the Sith you spoke to on Tython: Darth Arkous. Member of the Dark Council, organizer of the attack on the Jedi Temple.
You've found a connection between them?
Yes--they've both been paying visits to the same genetics lab, in an underwater facility here on Manaan. They're headed down there again as we speak.
How quickly can you arrange transportation? We can catch up to them and find out the truth before any more lives are lost.
Then we'll catch them both.
Is it some kind of medical treatment facility? Experimental research? Something else?
Tell me about the lab.
There's no documentation for the lab's purpose, but traffic in and out is mostly freight, not passenger. Probably research--which fits my other findings.
How long were you planning to wait before you contacted me? This is a major threat!
You should have called sooner.
I wanted more than just circumstantial evidence. And I got it.
With Darok and Arkous working together, the timing of the attacks makes perfect sense. They weren't really attacks at all--they were robberies.
Robberies? What do you mean?
The Imps hauled something out of the Jedi Temple just before you got there. A few security holos were still working, so I got a shot of it.
Darok's top guy, Commander Jensyn, grabbed something similar on Korriban. I ran the images through some databases--they were pieces of ancient Rakata technology.
Any technology that the Sith would keep under lock and key must be bad.
Sounds dangerous.
As in, technology from the ruthless empire that conquered the galaxy before the founding of the Republic?
Rakata tech?
Yes. You can understand my concern.
Ancient technology, galactic conspiracies, secret labs... should we get our heads checked?
This gets crazier every minute.
I probably wouldn't believe it either, if I hadn't seen all of the evidence for myself.
I'm pretty sure Darok and Arkous have brought their Rakata tech to the lab, but you're going to have to go in to figure out exactly what they're doing with it.
There. I've arranged transport to get you in, but security will probably come after you with more than smiles. Don't let them slow you down.
While you're searching the lab for Arkous and Darok, I'm going to meet with one last contact. I think she might have some interesting intel for us.
"She"?
You wouldn't believe me if I told you. Good luck down there.
There you are. Our first few interviews with Jakarro's "friends" went well, believe it or not.
We're going to start with some antique smugglers from the Exchange, see if the Revanites have gone for any other Rakata tech.
Have you found any traces of Colonel Darok or Darth Arkous?
Anything from Darok or Arkous?
Not one. Apparently the Revanites know a thing or two about staying hidden.
I'm glad to see you're still in one piece. It's a good look for you.
[Flirt] It's good to see you.
And I was starting to wonder if it was Lana you had your eyes on.
I still think working with a Sith is more trouble than it's worth. We can handle this on our own, Theron.
We can do that without Lana.
You're good, I know that. And I'm not so bad, either. But I still think we're better off spreading the work--and the risk--around a bit.
If the Revanites did manage to take us out... at least there will still be someone else going after them, even if it is a backstabbing Sith and a murderous Wookiee.
"The Order of Revan". Hmph. My family has even more pull than I thought.
You're related to Revan?
You're related to Revan?
You never heard that story? Bastila Shan, Revan's great Jedi love? The name made it all the way down to me, even if the Force didn't.
Look: Revan was a wild card, and his crazy cult of followers is bound to be the same.
Highly-trained bravado aside, we're up against some long odds here. Are you sure you still want to be dragged into all of this?
The Revanites are a danger to the entire Republic. We can't afford to ignore them.
This threat must be ended.
If you keep going up against impossible enemies, it's going to turn into a habit.
I follow the will of the Force. As long as I'm needed, I'll help--it's as simple as that.
The Force guides me.
Just like Master Zho always said.
We're not fighting odds, we're fighting people. And people can always be taken down, no matter what the numbers say.
Odds don't mean anything.
You make it all sound so easy.
I figure, the longer the odds, the better the payout. And I love a good payout.
Definitely.
I guess that's one way of looking at it.
I'm not going anywhere, Theron. You can count on that.
[Flirt] Of course.
Teams aren't my usual style, but I think I could get used to this one.
They tried to kill me. I'm not going to let that slide.
I won't quit without payback.
You and Jakarro will make a great team.
All right, I'd better get back to Lana and Jakarro before they... do... anything. I'll get in touch as soon as we get something concrete--stay safe.
Is that really necessary? Surely I'm not as intimidating as you imply?
You can understand our concern, I'm sure.
No need to play coy.
As I'm sure you can understand mine. I've come to help, and I can hardly do that without my weapon of choice.
Your mastery of the Dark Side is plain enough--but I also sense your intentions. You mean no harm.
I sense the truth.
Theron mentioned that you were quite perceptive. I'm Lana Beniko.
You've earned a little trust so far--I'm sure you wouldn't mind earning a bit more.
Convince me.
As pragmatic as described. I'm Lana Beniko.
After the day I've had, one Sith lord isn't worth getting worked up about.
I don't scare easily.
You see, Theron? We'll get on just fine.
If we just spent some time together, I'll bet we could come to an understanding.
[Flirt] Maybe so, maybe not.
I'm confident we'll be seeing a lot of each other in the days to come.
Lana Beniko: dedicated Imperial citizen and fully-armed Sith lord.
But you don't need to worry about that.
Sith can't be trusted.
Deception is one of the key weapons in the Sith arsenal.
Sith lie. It's in your nature.
You trust him, and lying is the core of his profession. Couldn't "Lana Beniko, terrifying lord of the Sith" earn the same trust?
Arkous manipulated her and her people, same as Darok did to us. She's already shared a lot of good intel.
Based on your work in the lab, we know that Arkous and Darok are working together, manipulating both sides for some third party.
They're Revanites. Members of the Order of Revan, a secretive cult that's had its claws in the Empire for many years. It seems they've pierced the Republic now, as well.
How large is this cult? What kind of resources do they have?
Tell me more about them.
Given what you uncovered in the lab, they're much larger and better funded than we'd ever guessed.
I helped pull Revan out of the Maelstrom Prison. I heard he died not too long afterward... was that incorrect?
Revan?
Not as far as Lana or I know. But dead men can be even better cult leaders than live ones.
I'm not sure I've ever heard of this "Revan" person.
Revan?
I'm sure Theron could tell you all about him.
He was a Jedi, then he was a Sith, then he was a Jedi again, all about three hundred years ago. I'll send you a history file.
They won't be so secretive once we tell everyone what they've been doing.
Let's expose them.
All of the physical evidence went down with the lab. How would we convince anyone?
We know the Revanites have highly-placed moles in both the Republic and the Empire. That means we have no idea who we can really trust.
Then it's up to us to stop them.
Droid! Tell them this is boring and I don't care about any of it!
Uh... my master, the incomparable star captain Jakarro....
...Is more interested in action than discussion. And this is his translator, C2-D4.
...Has a short attention span. And this is what's left of his translator, C2-D4.
Former interpreter for Her Imminence, Queen Lina of Onderon!
Yeah, we got that earlier.
All of it.
If you understand me, then understand this: the Pub and Imp left me to die--twice! I won't rest until I've tasted their blood!
I saw your list of known accomplices earlier--quite impressive. Could any of them help us find where these traitors might be hiding?
Of course! But I do the talking, understand?
Superb! Then if Theron agrees...?
Go ahead and get the ship prepped. I'll cover our tracks and catch up.
Very well. It's been a pleasure meeting you. May the Force ever serve you.
You'd better travel separately. If the Revanites put a tail on us, they won't know which to follow.
I don't think these cultists realize who they're up against.
Good thinking.
Suits me.
If the Revanites realize their trap didn't work, won't that make things worse?
Should we lay low?
I think it's better if they do see you. They'll have to alter their plans to compensate--and that's when they'll make mistakes.
Lana isn't our ally, Theron. She's going to betray us, sooner or later.
We can't trust a Sith.
You're probably right. But for now, she can be useful--the Revanites are just as dangerous to the Empire as they are to us.
We're going to need allies, even if they aren't as trustworthy as we'd like. But that doesn't mean we have to let our guard down.
I'd better get moving. Watch your back out there.
That's not all you've discovered, is it? You've found something else, something they've already done....
There's more, isn't there?
If Colonel Darok is working with the Imps, we need to move on him right away, before he can do any more damage.
So Darok is a traitor.
I haven't even gotten to the good part.
I've flown with some pretty nasty characters--didn't mean we were buddies.
Could just be a coincidence.
There's more.
Agreed.
We're going to get to the bottom of all of this.
Exactly.
Hold up--there's more.
Then I'll do my best to stay that way.
